article.description: Charles Jackson scored 15 points off the bench as Arkansas-Pine Bluff held on to beat Grambling State 53-51 on Saturday night, snapping a four-game slide.
article.headline: Arkansas-Pine Bluff holds on to beat Grambling State 53-51
article.linkText: Arkansas-Pine Bluff holds on to beat Grambling State 53-51
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Charles Jackson scored 15 points off the bench as Arkansas-Pine Bluff held on to beat Grambling State 53-51 on Saturday night, snapping a four-game slide. Jackson was 5 of 10 from the field, including three 3-pointers, and sank both of his free throws. Trent Whiting added 14 points for the Golden Lions (7-23, 5-11 Southwestern Athletic Conference) who hit 42 percent from the field overall -- including just 4 of 20 from distance -- and 62 percent from the foul line. The Golden Tigers had a 26-23 edge at the break and held on in the second half as Grambling State outscored them 28-27. Grambling State made 14 of 42 (33.3 percent) from the field overall and 19 of 32 (59.4 percent) from the line. Deonte Hearns scored 23 points for the Tigers (6-21, 3-12) who have lost 11 straight games.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
